quotes.quote: The Spartans do not ask how many are the enemy but where are they.
Spartans, eat well, for tonight we dine in Hades.
The walls of Sparta were its young men, and its borders the points of their spears.
Being asked where in Greece he saw good men, he replied, "Good men nowhere, but good boys at Sparta."
Give them nothing, but take from them everything.
Come back with your shield - or on it.
He who sweats more in training bleeds less in war.
The daughters of Sparta are never at home! They mingle with the young men in wrestling matches.

After invading Greece and receiving the submission of other key city-states, Philip II of Macedon sent a message to Spart: "If I invade Laconia  you will be destroyed, never to rise again." The Spartan ephors replied with a single word: "If".

The Spartans were a paradoxical people. They were the biggest slave owners in Greece. But at the same time, Spartan women had an unusual level of rights. It's a paradox that they were a bunch of people who in many ways were fascist, but they were the bulwark against the fall of democracy.
No retreat, no surrender; that is Spartan law. And by Spartan law, we will stand and fight, and die.
That city is well fortified which has a wall of men instead of brick.
A Spartan woman, as she handed her son his shield, exhorted him saying, "As a warrior of Sparta come back with your shield or on it."
Only Spartan women give birth to real men.
The Spartans are the equal of any men when they fight as individuals; fighting together as a collective, they surpass all other men.
Mental toughness is  spartanism with qualities of sacrifice, self-denial, dedication. It is fearlessness, and it is love.
There's no room for softness... not in Sparta. No place for weakness. Only the hard and strong may call themselves Spartans. Only the hard, only the strong.
